#| echo: false

import json
from datetime import datetime

# Load music data
try:
    with open('_data/music.json', 'r') as f:
        music_data = json.load(f)
    
    last_updated = datetime.fromisoformat(music_data['last_updated'])
    top_artists = music_data['top_artists'][:3]  # Only show top 3
    
    # Generate the music section content
    artists = '\n'.join([f'- {artist["name"]} ({artist["playcount"]} plays)' for artist in top_artists])
    
    print(f'''
{artists}

<div style="display: flex; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
  <a href="https://open.spotify.com/user/ynkaqmrfxb88i0hq6ujzjju8z" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none;">
    <img src="https://spotify-badge.vercel.app/api/spotify-badge" alt="Spotify Profile" style="height: 28px; border-radius: 4px;">
  </a>
  <span class="text-muted" style="font-size: 0.875rem;">*Updated: {last_updated.strftime('%Y-%m-%d')}*</span>
</div>
''')

except FileNotFoundError:
    print("*Music data currently unavailable*")
except Exception as e:
    print("*Error loading music data*")
